name: Behavioral Design Cards
description:
The Challenge


Companies spend up to 7 times more on customer acquisition than on customer retention. Focusing solely on customer acquisition is like trying to fill a leaky bucket.


There‚Äôs an inflow of new customers, but there‚Äôs also a consistent outflow of existing customers. Applying the Hook Model by Nir Eyal can solve this problem.


The Solution


This card deck is based on the Hook Model by consumer psychologist Nir Eyal. This easy-to-understand and hands-on model proposes creating habit-forming products where four elements need to be present.

You will need the right trigger, you need to initiate action (by increasing motivation and ability), you need to provide an appropriate reward, and you need to make sure people make an investment in your product or service at the end to start the cycle all over again.


The cards contain information and examples on each of these four elements, with 50+ psychological principles and examples that influence people‚Äôs behavior and kickstart making habit-forming products.
